item.title: Epstein-linked longevity guru Peter Attia leaves David Protein, and his own startup ‘won’t comment’
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Attia co-founded longevity medical testing startup Biograph, which came out of stealth a year ago.

item.title: India’s Varaha bags $20M to scale carbon removal from the Global South
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Varaha's fresh funding is part of a $45 million Series B round led by WestBridge Capital.

item.title: The Minneapolis tech community holds strong during ‘tense and difficult time’
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Founders and investors in the Minneapolis tech industry told TechCrunch they've put much of their work on hold to help out their community.

item.title: YC startups can now receive investment in stablecoin
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: All startups accepted into YC will soon have the option to receive their seed checks via stablecoins.

item.title: 2026 plans: What’s next for Startup Battlefield 200
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: See what to expect for Startup Battlefield 200 in 2026, the ultimate startup pitch competition on the global stage at TechCrunch Disrupt. Join the mailing list to be the first to know when applications drop.

item.title: Skyryse lands another $300M to make flying, even helicopters, simple and safe
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Skyrsye, now valued at $1.15 billion, is pushing to get FAA certification for its universal operating system for flight.

item.title: Gradient’s heat pumps get new smarts to enable old-building retrofits
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Gradient's heat pumps fit in windows, minimizing installation times. Now, it is introducing software to make those units more intelligent.

item.title: Fitbit founders launch AI platform to help families monitor their health
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Luffu uses AI in the background to gather and organize family information, learn day-to-day patterns, and flag notable changes so families can stay aligned and address potential well-being issues.

item.title: Peak XV says internal disagreement led to partner exits as it doubles down on AI
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Peak XV is transitioning board roles and opening a U.S. office while continuing to view India as its largest market.

item.title: Two Stanford students launch $2M startup accelerator for students nationwide
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: "Breakthrough’s purpose is to fill in the funding and opportunity gap that exists in many of these ecosystems because students have historically lacked access to capital and the networks required to launch their entrepreneurial pursuits," co-founder Roman Scott said.

item.title: Carbon Robotics built an AI model that detects and identifies plants
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Carbon Robotics' Large Plant Model will allow farmers to kill new types of weeds without having to retrain the machines.

item.title: Meet the new European unicorns of 2026
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: From Belgium to Ukraine, five fresh European unicorns were minted this January.

item.title: HomeBoost’s app will show you where to save on your utility bills
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The startup is partnering with utilities to help homeowners determine the best upgrades to cut their energy use.

item.title: a16z partner Kofi Ampadu to leave firm after TxO program pause
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Ampadu's departure perhaps signals the end of the TxO chapter. The fund and program focused on supporting underserved founders by providing access to tech networks and investment capital through a donor-advised fund.

item.title: Uber is literally in the driver’s seat when it comes to AV bets
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Self-driving truck startup Waabi’s billion-dollar fundraise isn’t just about trucks.   The deal, for $750 million up front plus another $250 million from Uber tied to deployment milestones, marks a major expansion into robotaxis for the company founded by former Uber AI chief Raquel Urtasun. It also feels like another chip from Uber on the autonomous vehicle roulette table. With more […]

item.title: Uber puts another chip on the self-driving roulette table
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Kirsten Korosec, Anthony Ha, Sean O'Kane
item.description: Self-driving truck startup Waabi’s billion-dollar fundraise isn’t just about trucks.   The deal, for $750 million up front plus another $250 million from Uber tied to deployment milestones, marks a major expansion into robotaxis for the company founded by former Uber AI chief Raquel Urtasun. It also feels like another chip from Uber on the autonomous vehicle roulette table. With more […]

item.title: Last 24 hours to grab your plus-one pass at 50% off to TechCrunch Disrupt 2026
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Today is the last day to lock in a plus-one pass at 50% off to TechCrunch Disrupt 2026, happening on October 13-15 in San Francisco.

item.title: Apple buys Israeli startup Q.ai as the AI race heats up
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Q.ai is an Israeli startup specializing in imaging and machine learning, particularly technologies that enable devices to interpret whispered speech and enhance audio in noisy environments.

item.title: Upwind raises $250M at $1.5B valuation to continue building ‘runtime’ cloud security
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: The $250 million Series B was led by Bessemer Venture Partners, with participation from Salesforce Ventures and Picture Capital.

item.title: SpaceX is coming to the public markets, and secondaries are already on fire
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: paceX is reportedly lining up four major Wall Street banks for a 2026 IPO that could provide the reset the market needs.  The company just completed a tender offer at an $800 billion valuation, and secondary market demand is through the roof. If SpaceX goes public anywhere near its rumored $1.5 trillion valuation, it could trigger an IPO cascade for other late-stage unicorns like OpenAI, Stripe, and Databricks.  Watch as Equity host Rebecca Bellan […]
